title: How to Make Fried Bananas (Plantains)

steps.headline: Peel three large ripe plantains (skins should be dark yellow, some dark areas are acceptable).
Cut into 1/4-inch-thick diagonal slices; set aside.
Pour cooking oil to a depth of one inch into a 10–12 inch (25.4–30.5 cm) frying pan and heat.
Carefully place the plantain slices, several at a time, into the hot oil and cook, turning as needed, until golden brown, two to three minutes.
Remove from oil with a slotted spoon, and drain on paper towels.
steps.description: If cooking a lot, you can keep them warm in a 150 degree oven.

steps.headline: Add powdered or confectioner's sugar.
steps.description: Substitute these with refined sugar and serve as a dessert, such as vanilla ice cream.

text: Peel three large ripe plantains (skins should be dark yellow, some dark areas are acceptable).  Cut into 1/4-inch-thick diagonal slices; set aside.  Pour cooking oil to a depth of one inch into a 10–12 inch (25.4–30.5 cm) frying pan and heat.  Carefully place the plantain slices, several at a time, into the hot oil and cook, turning as needed, until golden brown, two to three minutes.  Remove from oil with a slotted spoon, and drain on paper towels. If cooking a lot, you can keep them warm in a 150 degree oven. Add powdered or confectioner's sugar. Substitute these with refined sugar and serve as a dessert, such as vanilla ice cream.
